title: Link
description: A hyperlink to other pages, sections within the same document, resources, or any URL.

type.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

content.description: The textual content of the link.

min.description: Generate a single fixed text value.

low.description: Generate a single arbitrary, non-recursive, inline node

high.description: Generate up to two arbitrary, non-recursive, inline nodes

max.description: Generate up to four arbitrary, non-recursive, inline nodes

target.$comment:
Note that this is equivalent to the `href` attribute on a HTML `<a>` element,
not the `target` attribute (which is used to defined where to display the linked content,
e.g. in a new browser window). May be the `id` of another node in the document (e.g a table or figure)

title.$comment:
This property is analogous to the HTML `title` global attribute which
represents ["advisory information related to the element"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/title)

rel.description: The relation between the target and the current thing.

labelOnly.description: Only show the label of the internal target (e.g. "2"), rather than both the label type and label (e.g. "Figure 2").
labelOnly.$comment:
This property allows for internal cross links like "Tables 8, 9 and 10" rather than "Table 8, Table 9, and Table 10".
A `Link` with `labelOnly: true` is equivalent to a LaTeX `\ref` whereas the default is equivalent to a `\autoref`.

compilationMessages.description: Messages generated while compiling the link (e.g. missing internal link or invalid external link).
